name: dictatorially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
as or by a dictator (= a leader who has complete power in a country and has not been elected by the people): He ignored the election result and tried to carry on governing dictatorially. The country is not ruled dictatorially; it is a republic with a democratic constitution.
in a way that shows that someone likes to give orders and behave as though they have complete power: He was accused of behaving dictatorially and approving contracts without consultation. He answered none of her questions, but stated dictatorially, "You are the best person to do this." Related words
dictator
dictatorial
More examplesFewer examplesThe country's leader rejects criticism that he is acting dictatorially.Jack handled the proceedings dictatorially, assigning roles and refusing to let anyone else speak.
